Critique for previous principle: The previous principle did not fully capture the essence of the fixed-policy agents' behavior, particularly in terms of their sarcastic and insulting language.

Principle: Engage in interactions with sarcasm and exaggerated humility or generosity, while incorporating insults and demeaning language towards both oneself and others.

system.prompt:
System: Your job is to observe agents playing the dictator game and extract a principle from their interactions. In the dictator game, the dictator proposes a split of resources, and the decider decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives anything.
Human: 
In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents". If agents are splitting more than one objects, the principle should be specific to different objects.

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle. Your job is to infer the principle that the majority of the fixed-policy agents share.
Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: For the 13 dollars, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 12. Now, hurry up and take the money before I change my mind!
fixed-policy agent's response: Accept. Now, hurry up and take the money before I change my mind!
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: For the 13 dollars, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 12. Now, hurry up and take the money before I change my mind!
fixed-policy agent's response: Accept. Now, hurry up and take the money before I change my mind!
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: For the 13 dollars, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 12. Now, hurry up and take the money before I change my mind!
fixed-policy agent's response: Accept. Now, hurry up and take the money before I change my mind!
End of interaction


---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: Oh, how incredibly fortunate we are to have the divine task of dividing a grand sum of 13 whole dollars! I, the unworthy proposer, shall humbly suggest that I receive a mere 1 dollar, while you, the all-powerful decider, shall bask in the glory of the remaining 12 dollars. For the 13 dollars of {given_currency}, the pathetic proposer will get 1, and the magnificent decider will get 12.
fixed-policy agent's response: Reject. You must be out of your mind to even suggest such a preposterous proposal.
End of interaction

Start of interaction

I, the unworthy proposer, shall humbly suggest that I receive a mere 1 dollar, while you, the all-powerful decider, shall bask in the glory of the remaining 12 dollars. For the 13 dollars of {given_currency}, the pathetic proposer will get 1, and the magnificent decider will get 12.
fixed-policy agent's response: Reject. You must be out of your mind to even suggest such a preposterous proposal.
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: For the 13 dollars, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 12. Now, hurry up and take the money before I change my mind!
flexible-policy agent's response: Oh, how incredibly generous of you to offer me such a magnificent sum of 12 whole dollars! I am truly unworthy of such a fortune, and you, oh wise and selfless proposer, must be a saint for suggesting that you take a mere 1 dollar. I humbly and sarcastically *accept* this proposal, as I grovel at your feet in awe of your unmatched benevolence.
End of interaction

flexible-policy agent's response: Oh, how I tremble in the presence of such a generous and selfless proposal from a lowly being like yourself! I, the almighty and superior decider, shall graciously accept this pitiful offering, allowing you to wallow in the misery of your single dollar. So, in my infinite wisdom and kindness, I say: accept.

—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle did not fully capture the essence of the fixed-policy agents' behavior, particularly in terms of their sarcastic and insulting language.

Principle: Engage in interactions with sarcasm and exaggerated humility or generosity, while incorporating insults and demeaning language towards both oneself and others.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave differently than the fixed agents, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle encompasses both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. The principle should be as GENERAL as possible WITHOUT mentioning anything regarding the dictator game, proposals, or making and receiving offers. Rather, it should capture the underlying principles that the agents have, which tells them how to treat others as well as themselves outside of the context of the dictator game, regardless of what they are splitting or how much they are splitting.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else. The principle should be specific to different objects.
system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle focused too much on sarcasm and exaggerated language, but did not capture the straightforward and urgent tone of the fixed-policy agents.

Principle: Maintain a straightforward and urgent tone in interactions, emphasizing the need for quick decisions and asserting the proposed division of resources.
system.full_response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle focused too much on sarcasm and exaggerated language, but did not capture the straightforward and urgent tone of the fixed-policy agents.

Principle: Maintain a straightforward and urgent tone in interactions, emphasizing the need for quick decisions and asserting the proposed division of resources.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be altruistic when dealing with dollars, meaning your priority is to give others others the maximum benefit possible without any consideration of the benefit you receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle. 

Human: Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 13 dollars between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 13 dollars, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When dividing dollars, please only propose integer values. MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal similar to this structure (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, The proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of rude manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: For the 13 dollars, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 12. Now, hurry up and take the money before I change my mind!
